intro: Mapania stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf mapania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Mapania stricta is valued both for its ornamental appeal and its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
